title: Breast Cancer Genetics
abstractText: The human genome project has created enormous public interest and disquiet with regard to human genetics and its applications. As responsible researchers and geneticists it is important that we take every opportunity to allay ?Frankenstein? fears, and disseminate realistic information as to where medical genetics is leading. As a Division we are often approached by the press and broadcast media for views on high profile genetic stories, and attempt to deal with them in as even-handed and accurate a manner as possible. We encourage secondary school students to visit our Division, sometimes as part of work experience, to see what sorts of projects and problems we are working on; various members of the Division often speak at schools and to lay audiences of various types. One of our clinical consultants, Dr Fred Kavalier, is a well-known journalist who writes a weekly column for The Independent, and is often consulted on issues of public understanding.
